parks.Title: Pineview Park
parks.Description: For those who live in the Rattlesnake, this park is a popular stomping ground. But others donâ€™t even know it exists! Tucked behind Rattlesnake Elementary at the end of Pineview Drive, this great park is away from busy streets, has a covered patio area with picnic tables, and a playground suitable for all ages. They even have tennis courts!

parks.Title: LaFray Park
parks.Description: Known to most kids as â€œThe Dinosaur Parkâ€ it is sure to be on everyoneâ€™s list of favorite parks. Although a lot of the playground equipment is best for ages 3 and up, this park truly is one of Missoulaâ€™s best kept secrets. It is rarely busy and located at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac. The street is easy to miss, but watch for Lafray Lane off of River Road. This park also features a covered patio area with picnic tables and a port-a-potty (hey, its better than nothing!)

parks.Title: Bonner Park
parks.Description: Bonner Park is one of Missoula's most popular community parks. Located behind Paxson Elementary in the University District, this park features: A spray deck,  picnic tables,  a reservable picnic shelter, with power  basketball courts,  tennis courts , volleyball net, inclusive playground.

parks.Title: Westside Park
parks.Description: Features to the park include â€œLowell Mountain,â€ which is a climbing structure with multiple levels, and a massive elevated rope grid. Also new to the park are improved basketball courts, a zip line, turf play areas and pathways.

parks.Title: Boyd Park
parks.Description: Welcome to Boyd Park, a street-corner urban playground located in downtown Missoula, Montana. Boyd Park's amenities include a full basketball court, paved multipurpose trails, a playstructure for the children, and an open grassy field suitable for many types of activities.

parks.Title: Dragon Hollow
parks.Description: Dragon Hollow is a magical play land adjacent to A Carousel for Missoula in Missoula, Montana. The play land was the combined effort of artists and consultants from Leather's and Associates, Inc., a playground architectural from Ithaca, New York, and local play area experts--the students of many local grade schools.

parks.Title: Kiwanis Park
parks.Description: Kiwanis Park is close to campus and has been a favorite among college students and citizens alike. The park is small in size but provides a huge number of activities and experiences to be shared. The park has great placement as it is located in downtown Missoula but in a residential environment.

parks.Title: Fort Missoula Regional Park
parks.Description: Fort Missoula Regional Park was envisioned as a destination park, to serve the greater Missoula area, county and region. The park, which opened in 2018, is the first SITES-certified project in Montana and the largest SITES certified developed park to date, March 2022. The character and programming reflect community-driven values and interests that were carried forward through schematic/master planning (2001), design development (Phase 1 - 2008 & Phase 2- 2012) and park construction (2015-2019).

parks.Title: Silver Summit Playground
parks.Description: magical playground in the heart of Missoula.  A playground where all children excited by the brightly colored equipment and inviting atmosphere discover elements that accommodate their bodies, mobility devices, or ways of playing.  A place enhanced by art and poetry that celebrates our diversity and strength.  A place that is more than the sum of its partsâ€“that builds community and exceeds our conceptions of what a playground should or could be.

reviews.name: John Reviewer
reviews.review: I saw a bear here the last time! Would be great if they only let the bears out when kids weren't there.

reviews.name: Paul Ryan
reviews.review: This is one of the best parks in Missoula! My daughter loves to play on the dinosaur and feed him pinecones!

reviews.name: My dawg
reviews.review: Sniffed a lot of things. BARK BARK!

reviews.name: Dude the Dude
reviews.review: eh, not as great as I thought.
